title.narrative: “Logistics Augmentation and Coordination in Support of the Humanitarian Community in Myanmar.”

description.narrative:
Proposed Activities
On behalf of the humanitarian community WFP will operate 10 helicopters to deliver relief cargo on behalf of the humanitarian community in areas not accessible by either road, barge or boat or in areas where no assistance have been given yet. The helicopters will be operating out of the five logistics hubs in Pyapon, Bogale, Labutta, Pathein and Mawlamyainggyum.
UNJLC will facilitate the booking system for the helicopters. In liaison with the "Cluster Coordinator" and the IASC Country Team a UNJLC Prioritisation Officer will monitor and follow up on all prioritised commodity needs by country, by region and by cluster and report their findings for asset tasking.
WFP as the Logistics Cluster Lead will continue to facilitate the logistics coordination, operate warehouses, boats and trucks in Myanmar and perform strategic airlifts out of Bangkok in support of all humanitarian actors.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project “Logistics Augmentation and Coordination in Support of the Humanitarian Community in Myanmar.”

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
